intro: Hibbertia squamosa, commonly known as the scaly sandblow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red-tipped petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, scaly hairs, giving it a unique texture. Hibbertia squamosa is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, arid environments.
